meanings.definition: To breathe excessively or too rapidly.
meanings.sent1: After running, I tend to overbreathe and feel dizzy.
meanings.sent2: Sometimes when I panic, I overbreathe and it makes me lightheaded.
meanings.sent3: During the yoga class, I accidentally overbreathe and almost fell over.
meanings.sent4: She tends to overbreathe when she's nervous, like a balloon about to burst.
meanings.sent5: The doctor warned me not to overbreathe during the breathing exercises.

meanings.definition: To inhale and exhale too much air.
meanings.sent1: When I have a cold, I tend to overbreathe to clear my stuffy nose.
meanings.sent2: It's important not to overbreathe during scuba diving to conserve air.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally overbreathe when I try to blow up too many balloons at once.
meanings.sent4: She tends to overbreathe during meditation, like a windmill in a storm.
meanings.sent5: The athlete was told not to overbreathe before the race to conserve energy.

meanings.sent1: During the singing competition, I tend to overbreathe and mess up the notes.
meanings.sent2: It's easy to overbreathe when you're nervous before a speech.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally overbreathe when I try to blow up too many balloons at once.
meanings.sent4: She tends to overbreathe during exercise, like a steam engine in overdrive.
meanings.sent5: The doctor advised me not to overbreathe during the relaxation exercises.
